content: this is a summary of a civil case that took place in the kaunas district court the court decided to dissolve a marriage and awarded a land plot building to the defendant the court also recognized joint obligations between the parties and personal obligations of the defendant the text discusses various aspects of matrimonial property including the division of property between spouses and personal property owned individually it also mentions obligations arising from gift agreements and succession as well as the right to compensation the applicant applied for the dissolution of the marriage establishment of the status of their daughter monthly maintenance for the daughter division of property and declaration of obligations towards creditors the court assigned the land plot building to the defendant without compensation to the applicant and upheld joint obligations towards creditors the court recognized personal debts of the parties and closed enforcement proceedings the court ordered the payment of costs with the applicant being refunded stamp duty and the defendant and the state bearing the remaining costs the court approved the dissolution of the marriage and assigned personal property to the defendant the court also recognized credit obligations held jointly by both parties the text also mentions other debt recovery cases involving different parties and courts the court dismissed the remaining application and ordered the defendant to pay the applicants costs and state costs for serving procedural documents
